intro: Theodorea daurica, commonly known as the Daurian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Theodorea daurica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
